summary: This bill, the "What Works for Preventing Veteran Suicide Act," aims to improve suicide prevention efforts within the Department of Veterans Affairs. It mandates the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to establish standardized practices for grant and pilot programs related to veteran suicide prevention and mental health. These practices include setting clear objectives, developing evaluation methodologies, communicating program details, conducting evaluations, and sharing results.  The bill seeks to make these changes within 180 days of enactment and apply to existing and future programs.
